fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models

Class AtomicModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventsExchangingI, ModelDescriptionI, VariablesSharingI, AtomicModelI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicES_Model, AtomicHIOA, ControllerModel, ServerModel, TicModel

    public abstract class AtomicModel
extends Model
implements AtomicModelI
    The class AtomicModel implements the most general methods and instance variables for DEVS atomic models.

    Description

    The implementation provided here follows the spirit of the description appearing in:

    H. Vangheluwe, Discrete Event System Specification (DEVS) formalism, courseware, 2001.

    Invariant

     invariant              true                    // TODO

    Created on : 2016-01-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Vector<EventI> currentStoredEvents
      Input events from the current simulation step waiting to be executed by this model; can be accessed concurrently for real-time simulation so it uses a Vector that is thread safe.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>,java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink>> influencees
      When not stand alone but run by a shared simulation engine, the set of other models that must receive events from this model.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AtomicModel(java.lang.String uri, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit, SimulatorI simulationEngine)
      create an atomic simulation model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      add the given influencees (models that import events exported by this model) to the ones of the given model during in a composition.
      boolean areInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> modelURIs, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if all of the models with the given URIs are influenced by this model through the exported events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      void causalTransition(Time current)
      do a causal transition i.e., an internal transition triggered by the internal transition of an influenced model; causal transitions do not produce external events.
      boolean clockSynchronised()
      return true if all the clocks in all the models are synchronised.
      void confluentTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do a confluent transition i.e., processing internal and external transitions occurring at the same simulation time using previously stored external input events.
      void endSimulation(Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation.
      void externalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      Contract pre this.getNextTimeAdvance().greaterThanOrEqual(elapsedTime) pre this.getCurrentStateTime().add(elapsedTime).
      Value<?> getActualExportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sourceVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sourceVariableType)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI the atomic one that defines the designated variable or its alias and return the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      ModelI getDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
      get a Java reference on the object representing a model that is a descendant or the model executing the method.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getEventAtomicSinks(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of atomic event sinks (description of an importing model) for the given event type.
      EventAtomicSource getEventAtomicSource(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the atomic event source (description of an exporting model) for the given exported event type.

      return the exported event types of this atomic model from the corresponding annotations.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getExportedVariables()
      return the variables exported by this HIOA.
      static java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>[] getImportedEventTypes(java.lang.Class<? extends AtomicModel> c)
      return the imported event types of this atomic model from the corresponding annotations.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getImportedVariables()
      return the variables imported by this HIOA.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getInfluencees(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of URIs of models that are influenced by this model through the given type of events.
      java.util.ArrayList<EventI> getStoredEventAndReset()
      return the vector of all external events received during the last internal simulation step through storeInput, clearing them up to reinitialise the vector for the next step.
      void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
      initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.
      void internalTransition()
      do the next internal transition, both calling the method userDefinedInternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.
      boolean isExportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model exports the designated variable.
      boolean isImportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model imports the designated variable.
      boolean isInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String destinationModelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if the given model is influenced by this model through the events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      boolean isStateInitialised()
      return true if the model is initialised and ready to start a simulation run.
      java.lang.String modelAsString(java.lang.String indent)
      return the model information as a string.
      protected java.lang.String modelContentAsString(java.lang.String indent) 
      protected void notifyParentOfExternalEventsReception()
      when required, notify the parent model when some external events has been received.
      void produceOutput(Time current)
      force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.
      void setImportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sinkVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sinkVariableType, Value<?> value)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI all of the the atomic ones that use the designated variable or its aliases and set in them the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      show the current state of the model during the simulation.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      show the current state of the model during the simulation.
      void staticInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the internal data structures of the atomic HIOA model from the static information about the model variables; this method must be called immediately after creating an atomic HIOA model and before composing it with other models i.e., is an integral part of the model creation protocol.
      void storeInput(java.lang.String destinationURI, java.util.ArrayList<EventI> es)
      store external events imported from another simulation model.
      void userDefinedConfluentTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do a confluent transition i.e., processing internal and external transitions occurring at the same simulation time using previously stored external input events; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models.
      void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.
      void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

      • AtomicModel

        public AtomicModel(java.lang.String uri,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                   SimulatorI simulationEngine)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        create an atomic simulation model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine != null implies simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    getURI() != null
 post    uri != null implies getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    simulationEngine != null implies getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

    • Method Detail

      • getDescendentModel

        public ModelI getDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModelDescriptionI
        get a Java reference on the object representing a model that is a descendant or the model executing the method.

        Description

        As this method returns a reference on a Java object, it must be used with much care. Models are not callable through RMI, hence it should not be called through RMI (i.e., among components). Also, direct access to the object representing a model should be read-only, as changing the state of the model can interfere severely with the simulation protocol.

        Contract

         pre     uri != null
 pre     isDescendentModel(uri)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        getDescendentModel in interface ModelDescriptionI
        Parameters:
        uri - this model or a submodel URI.
        Returns:
        the model with the corresponding URI.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        ModelDescriptionI.getDescendentModel(java.lang.String)

      • internalTransition

        public void internalTransition()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do the next internal transition, both calling the method userDefinedInternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.

        Description

        In the standard DEVS protocol, this method is assumed to be defined by users in their atomic models. However, having only one method to do so makes it difficult to include common behaviours for models. Moreover, DEVS allows to define new types of models where specific common behaviours must be implemented. With the traditional DEVS vision, this would end up asking the users to cater for these common behaviours in each of their implementations the method, an error-prone burden put on their shoulders. In this library, we prefer to split transitions in two parts:

        • a library defined part, here internalTransition, which implementations in abstract classes include their common behaviours and, for atomic models, calls the user model specific part;
        • a user model-specific part, here userDefinedInternalTransition, which implements the execution internal events of the user-defined models per se.

        After the execution of the method, the relationships between timeAdvance, getTimeOfNextEvent(), getNextTimeAdvance and getCurrentStateTime() is restored to reflect the wait for the next internal event.

        Contract

         pre     getNextTimeAdvance().lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post    getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract( getCurrentStateTime()).equals(this.getNextTimeAdvance())
        Specified by:
        internalTransition in interface ModelI
        See Also:
        ModelI.internalTransition()

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null && elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        ModelI.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • causalTransition

        public void causalTransition(Time current)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do a causal transition i.e., an internal transition triggered by the internal transition of an influenced model; causal transitions do not produce external events.

        Description

        This method has been introduced by the library when the HIOA models defined by algebraic equations were introduced in order to allow an implementation that reevaluates variables on request only. For other models, new variable values and events are produced by the execution of events, but in this case, this allows an influenced model to require new values only when they are needed this reducing the computational workload.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     current != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        causalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time.
        See Also:
        ModelI.causalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

        Contract

         pre    this.getNextTimeAdvance().greaterThanOrEqual(elapsedTime)
 pre    this.getCurrentStateTime().add(elapsedTime).
                              lessThanOrEqual(this.getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post   true                            // no more postconditions.

      • produceOutput

        public void produceOutput(Time current)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        Description

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing by their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        produceOutput in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
        See Also:
        ModelI.produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • notifyParentOfExternalEventsReception

        protected void notifyParentOfExternalEventsReception()
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        when required, notify the parent model when some external events has been received.

        The notification is required when the model is run under the standard DEVS protocol, but not for a real-time simulation protocol where the task to execute the external events will be scheduled by the model.

        Contract

         pre    true            // no precondition.
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • endSimulation

        public void endSimulation(Time endTime)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        terminate the current simulation.

        Description

        This method can be user-defined, allowing to perform some catering work like gathering data or computing statistics that depends upon the end time of the simulation (and that would likely be included in the simulation report of the model).

        Contract

         pre    true            // no precondition.
 post   true            // no postcondition.
